Maybe even one of the super optimized M1 or M2 processors? No problem! Xperience by Kentico runs great on macOS. Read on to see how to get your environment set up.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"b1380985-8ac1-498d-ab14-995d4415bb57","markdownStyle":"aeffb3bb-d079-4db7-9d8a-a9e3a8b64b5c","markdownStyleParsed":"edc7629a-a973-451f-9018-ef1af70a5358","markdownCodeLanguage":"a96819c0-684e-46f0-92d4-67122410c291"}}]},{"identifier":"c9aea230-d749-41fc-ad80-88d319278b04","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"e2262343-73d6-4495-9fb3-a030c4a1b56f","properties":{"markdown":"This post was written for Xperience by Kentico v27.0.1. Be sure to check the [System Requirements](https://docs.xperience.io/x/DgKQC) in the product documentation.","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"78eb4c49-f210-4f21-90f7-363a6f58d9fd","markdownStyle":"8c5895d9-2a39-42ff-b5b5-25fea8da9959","markdownStyleParsed":"044d58d5-d8c7-4151-94db-a8b20d170c7c","markdownCodeLanguage":"2aac70da-86e2-4184-8c56-4f1bf4979be8"}}]},{"identifier":"547ed4a5-6166-4241-ad35-953e017fc7b0","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"f1cda211-fb7c-4fa7-aa2b-4bbc420237d6","properties":{"headingText":"Prerequisites","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"1c4ababa-990a-489a-9608-ab5505bf5f13","headingLevel":"71487e4b-f9e5-4c75-9564-2c3e784a13d4","headingLevelsParsed":"6745220a-1c35-41d8-b7f1-ea8844049c09","showHeadingAnchor":"90556aba-fe58-4c19-8439-acbfafd5a878"}}]},{"identifier":"dcb70c76-01e1-46df-98a9-5286bcfc673d","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"960e47db-3d73-463a-99e5-5f814e6db084","properties":{"markdown":"To get started developing with Xperience by Kentico on a modern Mac, we'll need to first install all the toolchain dependencies. We'll start with the list and then we'll cover any details for each one.

- [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com)
- [.NET 6 SDK](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/6.0)
- [Docker Desktop](https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop/) or [OrbStack](https://orbstack.dev)

For each of these, you'll want to install the arm64 binaries if they are available, as these will perform the best on your M1/M2 Mac.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"26548917-9b14-4c9e-bdb5-e4bbd9de2f14","markdownStyle":"998183f7-ac82-4a4b-8e10-8d6a1c9e57ab","markdownStyleParsed":"06d66217-61d5-4352-a459-f3bef6385821","markdownCodeLanguage":"44c5a28d-889a-467a-8d82-75052a5746ed"}}]},{"identifier":"febdd4c8-4623-4b82-aa6c-5ccb4fde9e39","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"d156559f-b25b-423d-aac5-82ee1e68dca7","properties":{"headingText":"Visual Studio Code","headingLevel":"H3","headingLevelsParsed":2,"showHeadingAnchor":true},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"25272fdd-9e7a-49d2-8e24-7fc99fdd8707","headingLevel":"40b485a5-04e6-46d5-9005-eaa67b74cb85","headingLevelsParsed":"769c9bd1-ecdb-49e9-b6df-58805f2ed994","showHeadingAnchor":"443aef8d-e777-4ab2-9276-a0b5f4a4fd04"}}]},{"identifier":"fdaa9328-39fa-46b1-af2c-6707117745de","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"3e82a4aa-e356-4178-801e-2d6d9e1abaf6","properties":{"markdown":"The VS Code installation should be pretty standard, but we'll want to add a few extensions to improve the .NET developer experience.

- [C# DevKit](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-dotnettools.csdevkit)
- [.NET User Secrets](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=adrianwilczynski.user-secrets)
- [MS SQL Server](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-mssql.mssql)

These two extensions will give us language support and the MS SQL Server extension will allow us to connect to our local SQL Server instance and run some queries in VS Code.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"c368ad8a-7a95-4db4-8507-aa8ad8c79aa8","markdownStyle":"3d10c5af-efc1-440e-9c8f-e6610dcdc7e1","markdownStyleParsed":"2088c65a-55c1-4807-8995-0d8567aeafa1","markdownCodeLanguage":"4833a308-f2d7-45c9-bc32-0d2cd09109ec"}}]},{"identifier":"c2b42cb4-d268-4ca7-a669-2b2ed76d3ee3","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"8a588082-97eb-417e-a388-3d7e50682e2b","properties":{"headingText":".NET new -i kentico.xperience.templates","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"bash"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"37df01c5-7b2d-4055-8510-43e867b787da","markdownStyle":"fff79fca-f995-4f7b-94b4-a029034e18e7","markdownStyleParsed":"2aec9078-add5-4511-936c-c49f337bbb6d","markdownCodeLanguage":"e650939b-ada1-4e8d-9c55-e84a2f1bcdef"}}]},{"identifier":"b51d83ab-d8a2-4b99-be1d-cad71992f8fd","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"ba69d2b2-e46e-4f23-9858-d0c23151e579","properties":{"markdown":"These templates will help us quickly create a new Xperience by Kentico project with just a few commands at the terminal.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"5d1d1048-8dd5-49c4-b3ab-889ee0baea4c","markdownStyle":"7186ee74-094c-4dbc-9602-941d0f563632","markdownStyleParsed":"83133f7e-1225-4eff-bf00-d3803f7195db","markdownCodeLanguage":"7c4e1c4d-abdd-4b46-92b1-150e972e9852"}}]},{"identifier":"fb801dfa-5151-43e8-9432-b0c7d80424b9","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"184f50ea-1638-4ed7-96e2-4c04e469940b","properties":{"markdown":"If you are using a newer version of the .NET SDK (ex: 7 or 8) or you want to learn about the other project templates, read the [installation instructions](https://docs.xperience.io/xp/developers-and-admins/installation#Installation-InstallprojecttemplatespackageInstallTemplatesPackage) in our documentation.","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"49e8cf26-9207-49af-a5cc-f02badacaf99","markdownStyle":"6772f268-1a7a-4c73-a303-08f23fa1a772","markdownStyleParsed":"cdf8c15b-0e79-444c-9acc-13f902e1308e","markdownCodeLanguage":"d5eb3405-db81-4208-b167-6edb32dfccb2"}}]},{"identifier":"8af98d1a-6799-42d4-b3c3-a201fd590976","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"1f3b2aa7-958d-46cc-82a7-6a28ba42b74d","properties":{"headingText":"Docker Desktop","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"a21f1917-312d-4c8e-a868-5ff7b096010e","headingLevel":"7451a10f-5783-492d-b909-a0ebdb2d252c","headingLevelsParsed":"02b94e85-43d2-4046-bfc4-eed9a19e6286","showHeadingAnchor":"170797be-24c7-45f7-b71f-30a088eacea3"}}]},{"identifier":"2f0dfb16-54ce-46e1-a492-43d5f8d23ecc","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"3ef3ece5-c23f-4869-abc0-fbcef0135d95","properties":{"markdown":"Docker Desktop (or OrbStack) will provide a visual application to manage containers and images. It will also come with some smart defaults for setting up your environment for running containers.

Why are we talking about containers? Well, Xperience by Kentico depends on Microsoft SQL Server and the best way to run it on a modern Mac is using the SQL Server 2022 container, which runs on Linux, and Linux is what containers run in, even on MacOS.

We'll run two commands at the terminal. The first will pull the SQL 2022 image (the blueprint for all instances of SQL 2022 that we run) and the second will start a new instance as a container.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"589207dc-2919-4de6-a230-46d478d55824","markdownStyle":"781d4b0c-f589-4018-b46b-8318fa9484e8","markdownStyleParsed":"86dfaad0-dec1-4030-a51f-479ed01a7f0b","markdownCodeLanguage":"45c4ece8-07b1-4684-888e-edc68c410977"}}]},{"identifier":"7eb9ee58-207c-4ae9-bd90-579ef907f0bc","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"f71e94b1-44fc-4be7-aec5-4a4447d08a13","properties":{"markdown":"docker pull mcr.microsoft.com/mssql/server:2022-latest

docker run -e "ACCEPT_EULA=Y" -e "MSSQL_SA_PASSWORD=Pass@12345" \
 -p 1433:1433 --name sql2022 --hostname localhost \
 -d \
 mcr.microsoft.com/mssql/server:2022-latest","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"bash"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"94673693-ac93-4fec-a3c7-dd941648e044","markdownStyle":"a610bc00-da65-463c-ae3a-d68649a1b0ba","markdownStyleParsed":"d5e895b0-a443-4fd8-b059-9bab7346b3a5","markdownCodeLanguage":"dd11003b-151c-47eb-81e3-8f7f042b749d"}}]},{"identifier":"0512c350-d552-4734-850a-ab6299c558a5","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"238f3dd8-8062-41d2-ae2b-888eaaa3fc08","properties":{"markdown":"The database server connection details will be the following.

- Server Name: `localhost,1433` (SQL Server uses a comma instead of a colon to separate the host from the port number)
- Username: `sa`
- Password: `Pass@12345` (you can change this if you want)

We can test that our database server is up and running by using VS Code and the MS SQL Server extension to connect to it.

In VS Code, along the right side icon list, you should see an icon for the SQL Server extension. When you click it you will see a new Connections panel appear with a `+ Add Connection` link. Click that and a dialog will appear where you can start entering the connection details above.

You can leave the optional database name value blank. For the login type you want to select `SQL Login`. The credentials are the ones listed above and you can save the password for convenience when prompted.

For a Profile Name you can enter something like `localhost - SQL Server 2022` to help identify it in the future within the SQL Server extension Connections list.

You will be prompted to trust a server certificate, which you will want to accept.

Now you should see your new connection in the panel, which you can expand `localhost - SQL Server 2022` -> `Databases` -> `System Databases` -> `master`. Right click on `master` and select `New Query`.

Enter the following query into the tab that appears.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":""},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"0f32764f-cf9c-4ad5-956a-5f8b9226b3ec","markdownStyle":"940ad66c-6044-46a2-8edc-220ed57f55ca","markdownStyleParsed":"dab32607-aa04-463b-bc80-bd8b4aa0ed84","markdownCodeLanguage":"401794d1-148a-4aee-a538-155dbb8f0509"}}]},{"identifier":"8b1f8278-2124-4be6-a40d-e3f9957a596c","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"fade1b69-3c89-44ae-a7c6-02e0ddc2fb95","properties":{"markdown":"SELECT *
FROM SYS.Databases","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"sql"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"f4de78ff-44fc-4bc8-86a5-f50a9d10884b","markdownStyle":"01896a9e-b7c8-464d-9fd2-72c8eaf06157","markdownStyleParsed":"275008f7-6491-4a6d-a22b-f0b90c664394","markdownCodeLanguage":"695204ba-5c7a-416a-bc07-e6c142735425"}}]},{"identifier":"167df495-b571-4877-8ca7-6eee3f0f737a","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"44ffef34-ff44-4fac-8605-d5f32a68cbda","properties":{"markdown":"Now press the green button to the right of the tab name and you should see a new tab with the query results appear. If everything has worked so far, you're all set to setup the Xperience by Kentico
